bibl.title: William W. Tinkham v. Jasper Gates. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle

body.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE THIRD JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON TERRITORY, HOLDING TERMS AT SEATTLE FOR THE COUNTIES OF KING AND KITSAP.
In the matter of the application of William W. Tinkham for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

For on this 14th day of September, 1887, on the petiton of William W. Tinkham for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and the said Writ of Habeas Corpus and the return, thereto of Jasper Gates appearing in open court with the body of William W. Tinkham and the said Jasper Gates and the Territory of Washington appearing by Samuel L. Piles, Deputy prosecuting attorney for this district, and by L.C. Gilman; and the said Jasper Gates made return that he held the body of William W. Tinkham under the committment issued on the 2nd day of September, 1887. By John T. Mason, Justice of the peace in and for Skagit County; and the court having heard the evidence and arguments of counsel; and it appearing to the court that the said Justice of the Peace had no jurisdiction to enter the order made by him on the 2nd day of September, 1887, committing the said William W. Tinkham until the sum of $40.25 should be paid: an the said Justice of the Peace had no jurisdiction or legal authority to issue the said warrant of committment. And the said warrant is illegal and void; and the said William W. Tinkham is unlawfully restrained of his liberty, THEREFORE

IT IS CONSIDERED AND ADJUDGED that the said William W. Tinkham be and he hereby is discharged, and he may go hence without day, and that the costs of this proceeding be paid by the county of Skagit in this territory.
In the matter of the application of William W. Tinkham for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
BURKE & HALLER, ATTORNEYS-AT-LAW. SEATTLE, WASH. TER.
